text: Send the troops out foraging, enables recruitment and replenishment regardless of territory, and allows ingredients to be discovered.
Chance of finding a cooking ingredient.
[[col:yellow]]Grasses cultivated for the edible components of their grains[[/col]]
[[col:red]]Animal flesh that is eaten as food[[/col]]
[[col:blue]]Seed-bearing structures, usually sweet or sour, that are edible in their raw state[[/col]]
A relict crop sparsely found throughout the Old World.
A grass well-suited for surviving the harsh Norscan snows.
A cereal grain cultivated around oases in the Southlands.
Wheat attuned to the winds of magic.
A species of rice from Cathay, now invasive to some regions of the Dark Lands.
Corn that grows in the wild jungles of Lustria.
A strain of barley able to flourish in the frozen lands of the Dark Elves.
Beef from the great Aurochs of the Old World.
Salmon native to the Sea of Claws.
For generations, Arabyan shepherds have tended to a unique breed of lamb.
A species of squid found within the Inner Sea.
The lands surrounding Pigsbarter are home to herds of delectable wild pigs.
A species of iguana found in the wild jungles of Lustria.
A species of turkey found in Naggoroth.
Found growing in the wilds of the Old World.
Berries from a Norscan juniper tree.
Seeds from a species of kammun found rarely in the Southlands.
A sweet-smelling and ancient herb, native to Ulthuan.
A smoky-tasting spice, originating from the Dark Lands.
Dried pods from a Vanilla orchid, native to Lustria.
An unthinkably spicy cultivar of pepper.
A tasty breed of Lettuce that can grow to the size of a horse.
Sea kale found along the coasts of the Kraken Sea.
A rare species of lentil found within the deserts of Araby.
A strain of olive imbued with the winds of magic.
The ashy soils of the Dark Lands can sometimes host this pungent variety of garlic.
A species of tomato that grows in warm, wet climates.
A relict crop that dates back to the era before the Sundering.
A type of Apple originating in Bretonnia, but now found throughout the Old World.
Also known as Lingonberries, found growing in Norsca.
A date of the highest quality, cultivated for the Sultans of Araby.
A type of Pomegranate refined over the centuries by the High Elves.
An uncommon breed of walnut, found in the Dark Lands.
A relict crop found in Lustria, said to originate from the era of the Old Ones.
A surprisingly tasty berry that grows in the stinking bogs of Naggaroth.
A condiment used extensively in halfling cooking.
Pie with some type of meat inside.
Meat marinated with savory spices and slow-roasted over an open flame.
A sweet and healthy fruit salad.
A soup made from meat and vegetables.
A roast sweetened with some type of fruit.
Pie with some type of fruit inside.
Pie with some type of vegetable inside.
Soft and flaky foodstuff, made from some type of flour.
A dessert made from fruit and spices.
A dessert pastry good enough to be served to the royalty of Araby.
A Tilean pasta dish served with a tomato sauce.
A strange dish using raw fish, originating for the far off land of Nippon.

The Kitchen||Choose a delicacy for the Grand Cauldron chefs to prepare.
Number of turns until you can choose a new meal.
A New Ingredient for the Kitchen
One of Mootland's foraging parties has stumbled upon a new ingredient. This ingredient can now be used in the Kitchen to develop new and improved rations for our armies.
